SEARCH
Package pl.polsl.lab.asser.moustafa.model

Class Model

java.lang.Object
pl.polsl.lab.asser.moustafa.model.Model
public class Model extends Object
Model handles the data processing and storing and has all the methods used to process it.

Has methods to validate all types of inputs and then process it. Uses Class View object to log messages to the console. Encapsulates objects of class RomanNumeralGenerator and class ArabicNumberGenerator which are used in the conversion step after all validations are done.

Version:
1.1
Author:
asser.elfeki

  • Method Details

    • processInput

      public void processInput(String input) throws InvalidCharacterException
      Starts the processing operation of the input given by the user in the scenario of no given arguments in the command line. calls the isNumeric function and then calls the according validation function.
      Parameters:
      input - is the user's input in a string form.
      Throws:
      InvalidCharacterException - in 2 cases:
      • input is alphanumeric but is neither in Arabic or Roman notation.
      • input is not alphanumeric.

    • isAlphaNumeric

      public boolean isAlphaNumeric(String input)
      Uses regex to match the input to only letters and numbers.
      Parameters:
      input - User's input.
      Returns:
      true if there is a match, false otherwise.

    • isRoman

      public boolean isRoman(String input)
      Checks if the entered input is a valid roman numeric, using regex.
      Parameters:
      input - User's input.
      Returns:
      true if it is valid, false otherwise.

    • isNumeric

      public boolean isNumeric(String input)
      checks if the input is numeric or not
      Parameters:
      input - User's input.
      Returns:
      true if Numeric and false if not

    • validateArabicNotation

      public void validateArabicNotation(String input) throws IllegalArgumentException
      When the user enters a number in Arabic notation, it validates whether or not it lies in the accepted range which is from 1 to 3999
      Parameters:
      input - User's input.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number is out of range.

    • validateRomanNotation

      public void validateRomanNotation(String input) throws IllegalArgumentException
      When the user enters a number in Roman notation, it validates whether or not the input is in the correct format using a regex, and confirms that the input follows the subtractive notation used in Roman numbers.

      for example 4 in Roman notation is IV and not IIII

      It sets

      Parameters:
      input - User's input
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the input does not match the regex, which means it's not in correct roman numeric format.

    • convertToArabic

      public void convertToArabic(String input)
      Converts the entered Roman numeric to Arabic notation.

      it creates an object of class ArabicNumberGenerator that handles the number generating

      Parameters:
      input - User's input

    • convertToRoman

      public void convertToRoman(int inputNumeric)
      Converts the entered Arabic numeric to Roman notation.

      it creates an object of class RomanNumeralGenerator that handles the number generating

      Parameters:
      inputNumeric - User's input parsed to integer.

    • getOutput

      public String getOutput()
      Getter for the processed input. Used also as a flag in the Controller, as long as it's an empty String the program keeps running and prompting the user again to enter a valid input
      Returns:
      the converted number in any notation as a string
